oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Autry Inman - Dialogue on Piracy - Gift of Country Music Who's Who - 1971-09-03
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording of an interview with Autry Inman (performer/business owner), titled Dialogue on Piracy, recorded for Gift of Country Music Who's Who on September 3, 1971.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: [Unidentified] talks about piracy and bootlegging practices -- Autry Inman talks about having no knowledge of piracy and bootlegging -- Inman talks about what he does as being legal -- Inman explains his operation as buying tape and cartridge in bulk and manufacturing from there -- Inman talks about allegations being made against his operation as being illegal -- Inman talks about not doing recordings but making tape and cartridge products -- Inman talks about making reproductions -- Inman talks about the legalities of his operation -- Inman talks about other people's opinions on what he does -- Inman talks about making payments to songwriters from his reproductions -- Inman talks about if his operation became illegal in Tennessee he would move to a place where it is legal -- Inman talks about gladly paying artist royalties from his reproductions -- Inman talks about how many record duplicators are in operation at the time -- Inman talks about songs themselves being copyrighted but the performance itself being public domain -- Inman talks about his efforts to defend his business and concludes the interview
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Inman, Autry;
